direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods deal with the TreeBuilder instance, one setting it and the other retrieving it.
The parseInput method relies on the TreeBuilder set by setTreeBuilder to parse input strings.
The parseFragmentInput method also depends on the TreeBuilder set by setTreeBuilder to parse HTML fragments.
Both methods involve creating new instances of the Parser class, with newInstance creating a deep copy and setTreeBuilder initializing a new TreeBuilder.
Both methods modify the state of the Parser by setting different configurations (TreeBuilder and ParseSettings).
The parse method initializes a new TreeBuilder similar to setTreeBuilder, though it is a static method.
Similar to parse, the parseFragment method initializes a new TreeBuilder, though it is a static method.
htmlParser initializes a new Parser with a specific TreeBuilder (HtmlTreeBuilder), which can be substituted by setTreeBuilder.
Similar to htmlParser, xmlParser initializes a new Parser with a specific TreeBuilder (XmlTreeBuilder), which can be substituted by setTreeBuilder.
